Class Labyrinth

java.lang.Object
Labyrinth
public class Labyrinth extends Object
Generates a random "grid-maze" of individual squares arranged into a rectangular grid such that a path from the top-left to the bottom-right corner always exists. Squares are made out of either stone or lava. Stone squares can be traversed while lava squares cannot. A square is "touching" another square if it is directly above or below that square or directly to its right or left (diagonally "touching" squares are not said to be really touching in this context). The Labyrinth is generated so that one can move along touching squares from the start square (top-left) to the end square (bottom-right).

Coordinates in the Labyrinth are given in (row, column) form and not (x,y). That is, in general, the parameters of the methods below expect a row number followed by a column number. Both the rows and columns are numbered from the top-left corner and begin with 0, so that the top-left corner is (row = 0, col = 0) and, say, three squares down and four to the right would be (row = 3, col = 4).

A solution to the Labyrinth is a series of steps or "moves." These moves begin from the start (top-left) square and each move can either be to the square immediately above, below, to the left, or to the right of the current square. A solution is correct if the moves trace out a path along touching squares from the start to the end squares. Moves can be indicated in two ways:
  1. As an int[] array
  2. Using the class-defined constants

In the first case a solution is coded using the integers from 0 to 4 with:
  • "Up" = 0
  • "Down" = 1
  • "Left" = 2
  • "Right" = 3


In the second case, the solution is actually represented using an int[][] array. The class has defined constants UP, DOWN, LEFT, and RIGHT which are all int[] arrays with two elements representing a particular motion through the grid. The numeric value of these constants, while perhaps useful, is of no real importance outside the class.

    int
    cols
    The number of columns in the Labyrinth grid.
    static int[]
    DOWN
    Utility constant representing moving down a column, staying in the same row.
    static int[]
    LEFT
    Utility constant representing moving left in a row, staying in the same column.
    static int[]
    RIGHT
    Utility constant representing moving right in a row, staying in the same column.
    int
    rows
    The number of rows in the Labyrinth grid.
    static int[]
    UP
    Utility constant representing moving up a column, staying in the same row.

  • Constructor Details

    • Labyrinth

      public Labyrinth​(int rows, int cols)
      Constructs a random labyrinth with specified width and height.
      Parameters:
      rows - the desired number of rows in the Labyrinth
      cols - the desired number of columns in the Labyrinth

  • Method Details

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid​(int row, int col)
      Check if the given row and column is on the grid.
      Parameters:
      row - a potential row number
      col - a potential col number
      Returns:
      true if the given row and column is on the grid.

    • isStone

      public boolean isStone​(int row, int col)
      Checks if a given grid square is stone (or lava).
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the grid square to check.
      col - the column of the grid square to check.
      Returns:
      true if the given square is stone, false if lava.

    • solves

      public boolean solves​(int[] solution)
      Checks if a given set of instructions accurately solves the labyrinth.
      Parameters:
      solution - an array of integers representing the directions to move from the start square to the end square. With 0 = up, 1 = down, 2 = left, and 3 = right.
      Returns:
      true if the given solution is correct, otherwise false.

    • solves

      public boolean solves​(int[][] solution)
      Checks if a given set of instructions accurately solves the labyrinth.
      Parameters:
      solution - an int[][] array using the class-defined constants UP, DOWN, LEFT, and RIGHT detailing the steps to the final square from the start square.
      Returns:
      true if the given solution is correct, otherwise false.

    • printGrid

      public void printGrid()
      Prints the Labyrinth to StdOut. Mostly usefule for testing.

    • main

      public static void main​(String[] args)
      Tests the Labyrinth class by generating a random Labyrinth with dimensions determined from command line
      Parameters:
      args - command line arguments. First the number of rows, then columns.
